reviews.review: Micheal myers ile yargı dağıtmak çok iyiyi
아직 다 먹어보진 않았지만 김치가 너무 맵습니다. 그래서 좀 더 먹어봐야겠...

I've played DbD for 70h and I can say that: 
1)Survivors so underpowered they are simply toys for the killers, they are slower, weaker, they cannot block killer in any means, despite sucking flashlight. It rather cool to play as survivor with 3 of your friends, nevertheless you will still suck against that all new killers and their abilities.
2)Killers are OP, by OP I mean really OP: they fast as fuck, have their HEX ruin which may 1 shot you at the end, memnto mori, camping and tunneling you at the same time. I played as a killer several times and it was so easy to kill everyone as legion and oni, without any perks they are destroying full stacked survivors.
3)It is not worth to buy this game right now.

For devs if you are reading it:
I am really dissapointed right now about the game, It is not fun to play. Fix killers and their abilities, for example clowns perk that can damage generator by 30% when survivor is hooked, he can do it several time per trial. Survivors need some buffs here and there, may be some personal abilities as killers have to balance this mix somehow. I believe that game may be great again, but now it is greatly on the killers side.

Jogo excelente, principalmente jogando com amigos. Dificuldade variavel, ja que só depende de quão bem seu time e o assassino jogam. Atualizações constantes que trazem personagens que normalmente só podem ser adquiridos de forma paga, porém rola alguns eventos em data festiva. 

Possui um modo de progresso bom, que prende o jogador até adquirir todas as vantagens a fim de rejogar cada partida de forma diferente. Vale a pena. Compre com seu amigo.

After 100 hours you're either done with the soloq mm or you're red rank easy, Very straight forward multiplayer gameplay. An interesting game but a disappointing community and devs let it down.

I hate this game so much. Would love to have it removed off of the Steam store page.

Edit: I mean it now. 1,270 hours with nothing to show for it aside from misery

I've played this game the most out of any other PC game I own, and I've had a great time doing so. The amount of hours I have put into it right now doesn't seem like much, but to me, it sure is. I also hope to keep this number rising as time goes on. I was recommended this game by a group of friends, and at first, I honestly wasn't a huge fan of it. It just seemed like the same thing every match, and all I played was Survivor. It took about two or three months of owning it to start trying Killer, which I fell in love with. Something about it just makes it an endless pool of fun. A game you can grind, a game you can mess around in, but also a game you can just have fun. With the sweet aura that highlights my Killer experience, there is some things I will say that I do not like about this game. Number one, Survivor. This is just my personal preference, and maybe I do still need to dig into it a little more to fully grasp what it is all about. Though, the reason I didn't start playing this game all the time from owning it, was because all I played was Survivor. That was honestly really boring to me. There was no cool abilities like the Killers have, and so for that reason I wasn't the biggest fan. But, that can completely flip itself over when you play with a group of friends, not only do you have a coordinated team, but also it just feels a lot more enjoyable with people you know. Another thing I must say and point out, which isn't opinion at all, is this game is not very balanced. For both Killer and Survivor at equal times. I know it's quite difficult to make it all fair and square, but some stuff is just straight stupid. They took a step in the right direction recently with changing how Moris work, but next they should focus on something like Keys. Those are just awful. No matter how good you are as a Killer, multiple Survivors can escape with a key. Next, and I say this with a Killer POV, but when you run into a good Survive with Friends team, it is next level hard for you as a Killer in the higher ranks. Now, that stuff is really annoying, but the good things about this game outweigh the bad in my personal opinion, and that's why I will continue playing it. If you are going to play this game as a Killer or maybe even a Survivor, I suggest to not take it completely serious. You will get very frustrated at times, and see what I'm saying with just casually playing the game. I found the game much more enjoyable if I just didn't care as much. There is a very toxic side to the community, whether it's in the game, the end game chat, there's a lot of toxicity. With that all out of the way, I do still recommend this game, but beware of things I talked about. From a Killer main with some experience in Survivor. If you end up getting this game, have fun! The entity is waiting.

I have low specs lappy ,and it run at 15-20 fps at low graphics because i have no graphics card.I got to knw abt it from mobile game.One day I saw a streamer who played cod mobile playing this game on mobile and i found it very interesting at the same time i downloaded it and grinded this game so hard on mobile device.but my curiosity didn't stopped there.I got to knw that there's a pc variant too and i couldnt help myself but to buy this game,even though i knew it wont run properly.At last i play at 15-20 fps but i still enjoy the game.Too many characters and abilities and ofc killers too.This is too fun when played with friends!

O jogo é mt divertido e tem uma ideia muito boa, mas como em quase todos os jogos hj em dia, a cada 10 partidas, 9 vc vai jogar com players tóxicos, e se você for jogar solo de survivor, já prepara o seu rivotril ai. Pra escapar numa partida solo, vc vai ter que correr do killer, tirar seus companheiros do hook, fazer 5 geradores e fazer todos os totens, porque o seu time vai estar agachado (com urban evasion), ou em algum canto se curando (com self care), ou dentro de um armário, a cada vez que eles ouvirem os batimentos acelerando, ou nem isso.
Meu conselho é, compre e jogue se vc tiver SEMPRE 3 pessoas para jogar junto, ou jogue de killer, porém se prepare para ler merda atrás de merda.

The reason I'm quitting this game is specifically due to the development team's lack of critical thought with respect to game balance. Yes, I understand the game is an asymmetrical horror-action-fps-chase, but there should be some balance between the killer & the four survivors. 

First off, I fell in love with this game because it is a game of information processing & strategic decision-making. The difference between a great killer and a mediocre one is the ability to make the best min/max strategic in-game decisions based off information from perks, powers, or the survivors' interactions with the map.

After patch 4.4.1 from the killer's perspective, the game became a generator rush-fest. Survivors playing in a party of four have the ability to abuse not only insanely strong in-game perks/items, but also the ability to be on comms to "outplay" the killer (this is not new but the gameplay shift allows for survivors not to get rescued until they are at death's door). Right now the true killers in the game are  the survivors, not the killers (horror genre, HA).

It seems like this game is suffering from a LOT of powercreep from previous patches and BHVR isn't concerned the least bit. It's sad to put down a game I was supporting by purchasing the licensed killers & survivors I wanted to unlock perks for, but I won't play a game where a development team has no regard for balance issues.

Until the game evolves back into dynamic gameplay, where it feels like a team of four people have to take pressure off each other to have a chance to live, then I'll consider dusting this game off of the shelf. 

PS: Killer main, but occasionally plays survivor for dailies/boredom
PSS: The greatest killer in DBD? The Devs....
